intro: Macleania floribunda, commonly known as the Hawaiian firecracker plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its vibrant orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling firecrackers, hence its common name. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Macleania floribunda thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland habitats.
